That's a great idea! Checking out the IPMS website and looking for a local chapter near you is a fantastic way to get involved with the organization and meet other modelers in your area. It's a great way to learn from others, get feedback on your models, and stay motivated to continue improving your skills.

Entering a model contest can be a great experience, too! It's a fantastic way to showcase your work, get feedback from experienced judges, and see the work of other modelers. Plus, it's a great way to challenge yourself to improve your skills and push yourself to try new things.

Remember, IPMS is a welcoming organization that's open to modelers of all skill levels. Don't be intimidated if you're new to the hobby or feel like your skills aren't up to par. The goal of IPMS is to promote the hobby and help modelers improve their skills, so don't be afraid to reach out and get involved.

If you do decide to enter a contest, make sure to read the rules and guidelines carefully, and don't hesitate to ask questions if you're unsure about anything. And most importantly, have fun! Entering a contest should be a positive experience that helps you grow as a modeler, so enjoy the process and don't get too stressed about the outcome.

Good luck, and I hope you find a local IPMS chapter near you!
